isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - ADJUSTMENTS - CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200i DAY CAB MODELS WITH DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES BEFORE JANUARY 1997

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200 i DAY CAB MODELS WITH DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES BEFORE JANUARY 1997
svcproc.para: To adjust cab ride height, measure ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate (Figure 172). If dimension does not meet specified height of 5 3/16 inches ± 1/16 (131.8 ± 1.6 mm) for cab air suspension with single bag system, adjust as necessary using the following procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 172. Cab Height Measuring Points for Cab Air Suspension System for 9200 i Day Cab Models with Detroit Diesel Engines before January 997 and Cab Air Suspension System for 9100 i and 9200 i Day Cab Models after January 1997

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 173 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove one end of height control valve linkage (Item 4) from threaded ball pivot (Item 31, Figure 110) by unlatching linkage clip and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot.
Loosen one of the jam nuts (Item 7) and back off the nut several turns.
Turn the height control valve linkage (Item 4) clockwise to shorten the linkage or counterclockwise to lengthen the linkage to adjust the linkage properly.

important.para: There must be a minimum of 5 full threads engaged between the threaded rod and the linkage socket. If a longer valve linkage is required, contact Link Manufacturing customer service for assistance.

step1.para: Height control valve arm (Item 5) has a slot (Item 6) which will allow for course adjustment also.

figure.caption: Figure 173. Cab Air Suspension Height Control for Cab Air Suspension System for 9200 i Day Cab Models with Detroit Diesel Engines before January 997 and Cab Air Suspension System for 9100 i and 9200 i Day Cab Models after January 1997

step1.para: Reconnect height control valve linkage (Item 4) onto threaded ball pivot (Item 31, Figure 110) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place.
Re-measure the cab ride height, if necessary, continue to make adjustments until proper cab ride height is obtained.
When the height control valve linkage (Item 4) is properly adjusted, latch the linkage clip and tighten jam nut (Item 7). Tighten to Hand tight + 1/8 turn.
